name: Fresh Spring Rolls With Thai Dipping Sauce
author: USA WEEKEND columnist Jean Carper
summary: Science says: Shrimp is a good low-fat, high-protein substitute for meat and does not raise cholesterol.
ingredients: 6  spring roll wrappers (available in Asian markets)
½ cup peeled, seeded, chopped cucumber
1 tablespoon white-wine vinegar or rice vinegar
directions: In a bowl of cool water, soak a wrapper until limp
Place 1/6 of each ingredient down middle of wrapper, starting with lettuce
Fold over each end and tightly roll the wrapper around the contents, as if making a burrito
Moisten at seam; press to close
Lay on plate, cover with moist paper towel and refrigerate until ready to serve
Then slice in two and serve with Quick Thai Dipping Sauce, below, or peanut sauce
To make the Quick Thai Dipping Sauce, combine all ingredients in a small bowl
